summary: The Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act requires federal agencies and specific museums to return certain Native American human remains and other cultural items. Agencies have made some progress since the 1990 act, but hundreds of thousands of human remains and other cultural items have yet to be repatriated. In this Snapshot report, we look at how our past work could help agencies implement...
title: Native American Priorities: Protection and Repatriation of Human Remains and Other Cultural Items
